definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: The people's war has helped crush the feudal structure in the rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 人民战争摧毁了农村地区的封建制度。

sentences.english: But it was also a bold attack on feudalism and arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但它同时也是对封建制度和包办婚姻的一记猛击。

sentences.english: They are the hieroglyphics of feudalism succeeding those of theocracy .
sentences.chinese: 这是继神权政治象形文字之后的封建制度象形文字。

sentences.english: Their victims from the feudal system, become the accomplices of the feudal rulers.
sentences.chinese: 她们由封建制度的受害者，变成封建统治者的帮凶。

sentences.english: The fall of the West Rome Empire marked the beginning of feudalism in Eurpoe.
sentences.chinese: 西罗马帝国的灭亡标志着欧洲封建制度的开始。

sentences.english: Feudal economic structure formulated in Warring States period.
sentences.chinese: 战国秦汉时期是我国封建制度的奠基时期。

sentences.english: This feudal society, beginning with the Chou and Chin Dynasties, lasted about 3,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 这个封建制度，自周秦以来一直延续了三千年左右。

sentences.english: Feudalism was not abolished in England until 1660.
sentences.chinese: 英国直到1660年才废除封建制度。

sentences.english: This is the time of the feudal system.
sentences.chinese: 这也是当时封建制度造成的。

definition: bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
pinyin: zi1 chan3 jie1 ji2 ge2 ming4
